DataElement.preferredName: Systolic Blood Pressure Supine Position Evaluation Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the maximum arterial pressure occurring during contraction of the left ventricle of the heart when patient is in posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Systolic Blood Pressure Supine Position Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the systematic, objective appraisal of the blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart when patient is in posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

Concepts.definition: The maximum pressure exerted into the systemic arterial circulation during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

Property.preferredDefinition: A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the maximum arterial pressure occurring during contraction of the left ventricle of the heart.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
